revised_title: Single Crystalline Nature of Coccolith Elements in Emiliania Huxleyi
tldr: Researchers discovered that the radial segments of coccoliths in the marine alga Emiliania huxleyi are made of individual single crystalline units of calcite. The study used electron diffraction and high-resolution transmission electron microscopy to analyze the structure and growth of these calcite crystals. The findings provide insights into the biomineralization process and the molecular interactions between organic molecules and inorganic minerals in biological systems.
